page.title: 16PREHISTORIC SITE
page.content: High up on a mountain called "Mynydd Y Gelli," overlooking the old Gelli Colliery Site is Hen Dre'r Gelli (a prehistoric town). There are the remains of an Iron Age Hut settlement, Bronze Age Stone Circle and a burial cist. It was excavated by the Rhondda Naturalist Society between 1902 and 1905. Many things were found there including fragments of pottery, Bronze Age axes and flint arrowheads. The inhabitants were called "Beaker People." They buried their dead singly in a crouched position in Round Barrows, placing a beaker or drinking vessel alongside the dead chieftain. The exact position of the Site can be found on Ordinance Survey Map grid ref erence 977 940 (sheet 170) or by taking the Glyncornel Centre Walk Trail (number 7) on the Scenic Walks Fact Sheet (Number 3).
